item.title: To reinstate and extend the deadline for commencement of construction of a hydroelectric project in the State of Illinois.

item.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S4913; text as passed Senate: CR S4913)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S4913; text as passed Senate: CR S4913)
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 37.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici without amendment. With written report No. 108-22.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici without amendment. With written report No. 108-22.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Water and Power. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 108-15.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. (text of measure as introduced: CR S1674)

item.title: S. 220, A bill to reinstate and extend the deadline for commencement of construction of a hydroelectric project in the state of Illinois
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on March 12, 2003

item.title: S. 220, A bill to reinstate and extend the deadline for commencement of construction of a hydroelectric project in the state of Illinois
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on March 12, 2003

item.text: For further action, see H.R. 397, which became Public Law 108-12 on 4/22/2003.

summary.text: Authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, upon licensee request, to: (1) reinstate the license for construction of a specified hydroelectric project in the State of Illinois; and (2) extend the time required to commence project construction for three consecutive two-year periods beyond the date that is four years after the date of issuance of the license.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the Senate on January 28, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, upon licensee request, to: (1) reinstate the license for construction of a specified hydroelectric project in the State of Illinois; and (2) extend the time required to commence project construction for three consecutive two-year periods beyond the date that is four years after the date of issuance of the license.

(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the Senate on January 28, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, upon licensee request, to: (1) reinstate the license for construction of a specified hydroelectric project in the State of Illinois; and (2) extend the time required to commence project construction for three consecutive two-year periods beyond the date that is four years after the date of issuance of the license.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
